MeshID = | MedlinePlus = 003928 | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | }} In medicine, a
'nerve biopsy' is an invasive procedure in which a piece of a nerve is removed
from an organism and examined microscopically. A nerve biopsy can lead to the
discovery of necrotizing vasculitis, amyloidosis, sarcoidosis, leprosy,
metabolic neuropathies, inflammation of the nerve, loss of axon tissue, and
demyelination.
